bestBHT.bht: The portrayal here does not designate a specific individual, but rather emphasizes the near relationship of the betrayer to the Betrayed. The mention of dipping in the same dish underscores the extreme closeness and trust between them. It is significant that Jesus' sign of the betrayer went unnoticed by everyone. Judas, fully aware of Jesus' knowledge of his intentions, carries out his treacherous act.

Henry Alford: This description of the traitor here again does not seem to designate one especially, nor to describe an action at that moment proceeding, but, as before, pathetically to describe the near relation of the betrayer to the Betrayed.
Now however the relation pointed out is still closer than before—it is that of one dipping in the same dish—one of nearest and most trusted.
Archibald T. Robertson: It is as bad as that.
The sign that Jesus gave, the one dipping in the dish with me, escaped the notice of all.
Judas who understood perfectly that Jesus knew his purpose.
John Gill: In order to relieve their minds, and point out the particular person.
It is one of the twelve, that dippeth with me in the dish.

bhtAttempts.bht: One can infer from the first-tier commentary that the description of the traitor in this verse is meant to emphasize their close relationship to Jesus as one who dips into the same dish. This act portrays a deep level of trust and intimacy, making the betrayal all the more significant. The second-tier commentary highlights that Jesus' sign went unnoticed by all, indicating that Judas was able to maintain his deceptive facade. Ultimately, the verse reveals how Judas, fully aware of Jesus' knowledge of his intentions, carries out his treacherous act.

The traitor in the passage is described as someone who is closely related to Jesus, sharing a trusted bond as they dip into the same dish. This intimate act signifies a deep level of connection and makes the betrayal all the more significant. Despite Jesus giving a clear sign, the others fail to recognize the traitor among them. Judas, fully aware that Jesus knew his intentions, carries out his treacherous act.

The depiction of the traitor, dipping into the same dish as Jesus, signifies their close and trusted relationship. This act of intimacy adds weight to the betrayal that unfolds. Despite Jesus giving a clear sign, the others fail to recognize the traitor among them. Judas, fully aware that Jesus was aware of his intentions, proceeds with his treacherous act.

The portrayal here does not designate a specific individual, but rather emphasizes the near relationship of the betrayer to the Betrayed. The mention of dipping in the same dish underscores the extreme closeness and trust between them. It is significant that Jesus' sign of the betrayer went unnoticed by everyone. Judas, fully aware of Jesus' knowledge of his intentions, carries out his treacherous act.

The depiction of the traitor in this verse highlights their close relationship to Jesus, as they dip into the same dish. This act of intimacy accentuates the gravity of the betrayal. The fact that Jesus' sign went unnoticed by all underlines the secrecy maintained by Judas. Despite knowing Jesus was aware of his intentions, Judas proceeds with his treacherous act.
